context: The Finnish verb 'kytkeä' means to connect, hook up or switch something on. It is a transitive verb, meaning it requires an object. The word can also mean to disconnect or decouple when used with the particle 'irti'.  It conjugates regularly and has various forms depending on tense and person, as shown in the dictionary definition. For example, 'kytken' means 'I connect', while 'olen kytkenyt' means 'I have connected'.
